item.title: Leaving WordPress for GitHub Pages
item.description: I’ve been a WordPress user since 2007, continuously maintaining personal writing sites. I grew along with the product, moving from a casual hobbyist suffering through the Famous 5-minute Install to a WordPress professional, making my living from the open source CMS.

item.title: WordPress, In crisis
item.description: One of the selling points for (the free software that is) WordPress is its user friendliness. Intuitive, accessible, open—all of these words are at the root of what WordPress is and why it is of such benefit to the publishing world.

item.title: The cost of a basic WordPress site
item.description: Stop me if you heard this one. A person walks up to a web developer and asks, “So how much would it cost for, like, a basic website?

item.title: Rethinking the WordPress writing experience
item.description: Before I was a web professional, before all the project management, front-end coding, and CMS rejiggering, I was an English major.
